issue.title: Gazebo-2.1.0 fails to compile on ARM

content.html:
I changed the definition in my local machine and the compilation (I meant just the compilation, not the linking) seems to be fine after applying the patch:

diff -r e543cceecd13 gazebo/gui/building/BuildingEditorWidget.cc
--- a/gazebo/gui/building/BuildingEditorWidget.cc   Sat Jan 11 01:56:03 2014 +0100
+++ b/gazebo/gui/building/BuildingEditorWidget.cc   Thu Jan 16 15:38:06 2014 +0100
@@ -87,9 +87,9 @@
 /////////////////////////////////////////////////
 void BuildingEditorWidget::resizeEvent(QResizeEvent *_event)
 {
-  double boundingWidth = std::max(this->minimumWidth, _event->size().width());
+  qreal boundingWidth = std::max(this->minimumWidth, _event->size().width());
   boundingWidth = std::max(boundingWidth, this->scene->sceneRect().width());
-  double boundingHeight = std::max(this->minimumHeight,
+  qreal boundingHeight = std::max(this->minimumHeight,
       _event->size().height());
   boundingHeight = std::max(boundingHeight, this->scene->sceneRect().height());
   this->scene->setSceneRect(-boundingWidth/2, -boundingHeight/2,

There are problems with the linking of some libraries, but I believe that is the problem of changing the typedef on-the-fly and using qt binary libraries compiled with a different definition of qreal.

@rmattes any chance of including this patch in the fedora package and try the compilation again?

issue.title: Gazebo-2.1.0 fails to compile on ARM

content.raw: Absolutely, I'll integrate the patch and kick off another build tonight.
content.html: Absolutely, I'll integrate the patch and kick off another build tonight.

issue.title: Gazebo-2.1.0 fails to compile on ARM

content.raw:
It looks like the patch you provided fixed that issue.  Hpwever, the build errored out again much further along:
http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=6417517

CMake only adds -fPIC to the CFLAGS when building sources for shared libraries; static libraries don't get the same treatment. It looks like when libgazebo_gui_terrain.a gets linked into libgazebo_gui.so, the -fPIC on the shared libraries and no -fPIC on the static libraries is causing some errors on ARM.  CMake 2.8.9 and higher have a target property called POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE that you can turn on to make it include -fPIC in that target; I have another build running now that added it to libgazebo_gui_terrain and gzpropertybrowser to see if that solves the problem:
http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=6417959
content.html:
It looks like the patch you provided fixed that issue. Hpwever, the build errored out again much further along: http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=6417517

CMake only adds -fPIC to the CFLAGS when building sources for shared libraries; static libraries don't get the same treatment. It looks like when libgazebo_gui_terrain.a gets linked into libgazebo_gui.so, the -fPIC on the shared libraries and no -fPIC on the static libraries is causing some errors on ARM. CMake 2.8.9 and higher have a target property called POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE that you can turn on to make it include -fPIC in that target; I have another build running now that added it to libgazebo_gui_terrain and gzpropertybrowser to see if that solves the problem: http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=6417959

issue.title: Gazebo-2.1.0 fails to compile on ARM

content.raw:
OK the last build I submitted worked, with the addition of the following patch (which depends on functionality that started in CMake 2.8.9)


```
#!patch

diff -up ./gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeLists.txt.fpic ./gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeLists.txt
--- ./gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeLists.txt.fpic  2014-01-16 21:57:13.505666340 -0500
+++ ./gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeLists.txt       2014-01-16 21:57:41.710749459 -0500
@@ -26,7 +26,7 @@ QT4_WRAP_CPP(headers_MOC ${qt_headers})
 QT4_ADD_RESOURCES(resources_RCC ${resources})

 add_library(gzqtpropertybrowser STATIC ${sources} ${headers_MOC} ${resources_RCC})
-
+set_target_properties(gzqtpropertybrowser PROPERTIES POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE ON)
 #set(CMAKE_PACKAGE_QTGUI TRUE)
 #
 #add_definitions( ${QT_DEFINITIONS} )
diff -up ./gazebo/gui/terrain/CMakeLists.txt.fpic ./gazebo/gui/terrain/CMakeLists.txt
--- ./gazebo/gui/terrain/CMakeLists.txt.fpic    2014-01-16 21:56:31.476055388 -0500
+++ ./gazebo/gui/terrain/CMakeLists.txt 2014-01-16 21:57:01.964224219 -0500
@@ -21,5 +21,6 @@ QT4_ADD_RESOURCES(resources_RCC ${resour
 add_library(gazebo_gui_terrain STATIC ${sources} ${headers_MOC}
   ${headers} ${resources_RCC})

+set_target_properties(gazebo_gui_terrain PROPERTIES POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE ON)
 add_dependencies(gazebo_gui_terrain gazebo_msgs)
 include_directories(${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR})

```

A lot of the unit tests failed or timed out, I'll have to figure out a way to recover the test logs from the ARM builders.
content.html:
OK the last build I submitted worked, with the addition of the following patch (which depends on functionality that started in CMake 2.8.9)

diff -up ./gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeLists.txt.fpic ./gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeLists.txt
--- ./gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeLists.txt.fpic  2014-01-16 21:57:13.505666340 -0500
+++ ./gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeLists.txt       2014-01-16 21:57:41.710749459 -0500
@@ -26,7 +26,7 @@ QT4_WRAP_CPP(headers_MOC ${qt_headers})
 QT4_ADD_RESOURCES(resources_RCC ${resources})

 add_library(gzqtpropertybrowser STATIC ${sources} ${headers_MOC} ${resources_RCC})
-
+set_target_properties(gzqtpropertybrowser PROPERTIES POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE ON)
 #set(CMAKE_PACKAGE_QTGUI TRUE)
 #
 #add_definitions( ${QT_DEFINITIONS} )
diff -up ./gazebo/gui/terrain/CMakeLists.txt.fpic ./gazebo/gui/terrain/CMakeLists.txt
--- ./gazebo/gui/terrain/CMakeLists.txt.fpic    2014-01-16 21:56:31.476055388 -0500
+++ ./gazebo/gui/terrain/CMakeLists.txt 2014-01-16 21:57:01.964224219 -0500
@@ -21,5 +21,6 @@ QT4_ADD_RESOURCES(resources_RCC ${resour
 add_library(gazebo_gui_terrain STATIC ${sources} ${headers_MOC}
   ${headers} ${resources_RCC})

+set_target_properties(gazebo_gui_terrain PROPERTIES POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE ON)
 add_dependencies(gazebo_gui_terrain gazebo_msgs)
 include_directories(${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR})

A lot of the unit tests failed or timed out, I'll have to figure out a way to recover the test logs from the ARM builders.

issue.title: Gazebo-2.1.0 fails to compile on ARM

content.raw:
Indeed, seems like ARM does not support non PIC code in the shared libraries, but x86 can handle this kind of built (shared library with no PIC code).

This change will [impact in the performance](http://hardwarebug.org/2009/01/02/shared-library-woes-and-the-price-of-pic/) (no PIC -> PIC), probably nothing very critical. [Debian policy](https://www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-files.html) is against using no PIC for shared libraries, so it is a good reason to go with your proposal. I will prepare the PR.
content.html:
Indeed, seems like ARM does not support non PIC code in the shared libraries, but x86 can handle this kind of built (shared library with no PIC code).

This change will impact in the performance (no PIC -> PIC), probably nothing very critical. Debian policy is against using no PIC for shared libraries, so it is a good reason to go with your proposal. I will prepare the PR.
